Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2008 02:56PM staceyshusband wrote: It may be that you have dense breasts. My wife had dense tissue and a mammogram and ultrasound were useless in detecting her tumor.

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2009 05:50PM staceyshusband wrote: Well hearing from all of you makes me realize its not soÂ strange that scans won't be done. I think we're more likely to go without the scans now, but I will discuss further with the oncologist this week. Its strange too, my wife's plastic surgeon had no problem with the tissue expanders in during radiation. He just said we must wait at least six months after the end of radiation so the skin can heal. Then the implants go in. The radiation oncologist has no problem with the expanders in as well.
